newsitem.title: LUXEMBOURG: EU to study aid for Irish beef producers.
newsitem.headline: EU to study aid for Irish beef producers.

text.p: The European Union will study introducing a private storage aid for Irish farmers hit by cuts in EU export refunds and depressed prices, EU Farm Commissioner Franz Fischler said on Tuesday.
"We will consider carefully the possibility of a private storage scheme," Fischler told reporters after an EU farm ministers' meeting.
Irish Farm Minister Ivan Yates protested against a further five percent cut on Friday in European Union beef export refunds and called for special EU aid for Irish beef producers.

"This (refund cut) has had a very disatrous effect on prices in Ireland," Yates told Reuters, adding that the intervention system wasn't working properly and Irish prices had dropped to the lowest level for 20 years.

The cut, which followed a 7.5 percent reduction a few weeks earlier, was aimed at discouraging applications for export licences and keeping within a World Trade Organisation limit on subsidised exports.
Demand for export licences is running at nearly double the 15,800 tonnes a week needed to keep within WTO limits.
